intro: Crepis hokkaidoensis, commonly known as Hokkaido mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Crepis hokkaidoensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
